CCS Build Process

Back

 

To build any specific kernel for test, benchmarking or to pull in source code changes - just locate the associated project file, load it and run within the CCS environment. The sections below provide all necessary details to get started.

  1. Available CCS Projects
  2. Required Tools
  3. VXLIB Libraries Build Procedure
  4. VXLIB Individual Kernel Test Build Procedure
  5. VXLIB Full Kernel Test Regression Build Procedure

 

Available CCS Projects

VXLIB provides three types of CCS projects which build for C66 DSP:
  1. Library Makefile Project (VXLIB_LIB_GEN): Located in packages/ti/vxlib/lib folder. This makefile project builds vxlib, vxlib_cn, vlib_bamplugin, and common libraries by default (uses (g)make .libraries,e66 command). This default can be changed in the Properties->Build window of the project. The follwoing build targets are alternative options to the default.
    • all,e66 : All C66 DSP libraries (same as .libraries,e66 since this makefile only creates libraries)
      • lib/vxlib.ae66 : C66 DSP vxlib optimized library
      • lib/vxlib_cn.ae66 : C66 DSP vxlib natural c library
      • lib/vxlib_bamplugin.ae66 : C66 DSP vxlib bamplugin library (depends on ALGFRAMEWORK and DMAUTILS packages)
      • lib/common.ae66 : C66 DSP common test utilities library
    • clean : All libraries
  2. Kernel Test Projects (VXLIB_<kernel name>_66_LE_ELF): Located in each kernel packages/ti/vxlib/src/vx/<kernel> folder. These projects build the test code for the kernel, and is dependent on (links against) vxlib, vxlib_cn, and common libraries from the Library Makefile Project
  3. Kernel Regression Project (RegressionTest_66_LE_ELF): Located in examples/Regression folder. This project builds the full kernel regression executable. It is dependent on (links against) vxlib, vxlib_cn, and common libraries from Library Makefile Project. It also build a library of each kernel's test functions (*_idat.c, *_d.c), and then build the main.c and link it all together for the executable.

 

Required Tools

The following tools are required to build VXLIB using CCS (links provided). Download and install all tools to a single local (C:) directory, for example, c:\ti.

  • Code Generation Tools Version 7.4.2
  • CCS Versions 5.4 or higher

Note:
A "My.TI" account is required for download and can be registered at my.ti.com

 

VXLIB Libraries Build Procedure

The VXLIB libraries (vxlib, vxlib_cn, vxlib_bamplugin, & common) may be compiled with CCS following the procedure below.

  1. Open CCS Version 5.4 or later
  2. Import the VXLIB makefile based project
    • Open the Project menu
    • Select Import Existing Eclipse Project
    • Import VXLIB_LIB_GEN project from the VXLIB /packages/ti/vxlib/lib directory
  3. Make modifications to the project (optional)
    • By default, the release build configuration is enabled, and the all,e66 target is chosen.
    • To change the build configuration or target of makefile:
      • Select Properties from Project menu
      • Select Build on the left panel
        • To change build configuration to debug, click on the Variables tab and add a new variable: DEBUG = yes
        • To change the target of the makefile, click on the Behaviour tab and modify the target in the Make build target fields to match one of the makefile targets in Available CCS Projects.
    • After making change, close the window by clicking OK
  4. Build the project
    • Select Rebuild Active Project from Project menu
    • Note:
      This procedure uses a makefile project using the same makefile mentioned at Available Makefiles. It therefore uses the settings from this makefile instead of the CCS project settings.

 

VXLIB Individual Kernel Test Build Procedure

Any individual kernel within VXLIB may be compiled and tested via CCS following the procedure below:

  1. Open CCS
  2. Import the VXLIB kernel project
    • Open the Project menu
    • Select Import Existing Eclipse Project
    • Import from the VXLIB /packages/ti/vxlib/src/vx/<kernel> directory
  3. Use the Debug/Release profile for debugging/modifing/optimizing kernels
    • Open the Project menu
    • Select Active Build Configuration and set to Debug/Release
  4. Build and test the project
    • Select Rebuild Active Project from Project menu
    • Test using the proper target configuration

 

VXLIB Full Kernel Test Regression Build Procedure

The VXLIB full kernel test regression may be compiled with CCS following the procedure below.

  1. Open CCS
  2. Import the VXLIB test regression project
    • Open the Project menu
    • Select Import Existing Eclipse Project
    • Import from the VXLIB /examples/Regression directory
  3. Use the Debug/Release profile for debugging/modifing/optimizing kernels
    • Open the Project menu
    • Select Active Build Configuration and set to Debug/Release
  4. Build and test the project
    • Select Rebuild Active Project from Project menu
    • Test using the proper target configuration
